thread.title: Former Chancellor Lord Geoffrey Howe dies aged 88
thread.title_full: Former Chancellor Lord Geoffrey Howe dies aged 88 | Wales - ITV News

author: itv.com
title: Former Chancellor Lord Geoffrey Howe dies aged 88
text:
Former Chancellor Lord Geoffrey Howe has died aged 88, after a suspected heart attack.
Credit: PA Wire Lord Howe, from Aberavon in Port Talbot, was Margaret Thatcher's longest-serving Cabinet Minister, but was thought by many to have ended her premiership with a devastating resignation speech in 1990.
Prime Minister David Cameron has described Geoffrey as 'the quiet hero of the first Thatcher government'.
A statement issued by his family said he died after enjoying a local jazz concert with his wife.
It is with deep sadness that the Howe family today announced that Geoffrey Howe died suddenly late yesterday evening, aged 88, at his home in Warwickshire, of a suspected heart attack, after enjoying a local jazz concert with his wife Elspeth.There will be a private family funeral, followed by a memorial service in due course. The family would be grateful for privacy at this time.
